info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 1:11AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Scattered snow showers continue over central and north-central Montana tonight... Scattered snow showers are increasing in coverage over central and north-central Montana tonight. The heaviest activity has been west and northwest of Augusta and along interstate 15 from Cascade to Wolf Creek. Visibility will fall below one mile at times, possibly as low as a quarter of a mile for a short time in heavier snow showers. Any new snow accumulations will be minor, generally less than one half inch. However, some of the heavier snow showers could produce a quick one or even 2 inches of snowfall. Those traveling should be prepared for highly variable road conditions with areas of reduced visibility and slippery roadways.
